context_of_use: This use case allows admins to manage user accounts and configure system settings within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: control system access and customize system settings
description: This use case enables admins to manage user accounts and configure system settings to ensure proper access control and system customization.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts and configure settings.
assumptions: The admin has the required permissions to perform the actions.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall permit admins to configure system settings.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific settings that can be configured by the admin.
main_flow: 1. Admin initiates the user account management process → System displays user account management options.
2. Admin selects a user account to manage → System retrieves and displays user account details.
3. Admin makes changes to the user account → System updates the user account information.
4. Admin initiates the system settings configuration process → System displays configuration options.
5. Admin selects settings to configure → System retrieves and displays current settings.
6. Admin makes changes to the system settings → System updates the system settings.
